特記事項:
この授業を履修するには、事前にレベル認定の申請が必要です。詳細は備考欄を確認してください。

本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
This is an all-English classroom. You greatly enhance your acquisition of English by speaking it. In addition, speaking Japanese limits your classmates’ learning opportunities. Please encourage each other to speak English. You lose participation points if you speak Japanese in class. Students can expect to meet in a computer lab at least one time a week. Students can expect 2-3 hours of homework per week. This might increase slightly around important presentation deadlines.

For Students permitted to take classes online: Due to the evolving public health situation, and in line with KGU policy, this course will be offered "on-demand" for those students permitted to do so. Please check your @kwansei.ac.jp email address regularly. I will be using my email address (kangaku.classes@gmail.com) so, please check that these emails are read. We will try to cover most of the course contents outlined below but this will probably be asynchronously (I will specify the deadline when I set the assignment). Do not worry, there will be some misunderstandings, and we will work through these issues together as best as we can.

第1回:
Session 1-General introduction to academic English including: Academic Word List (AWL) review and critical thinking skills
All sessions are conducted face-to-face.
第2回: Session 2-Academic writing: sample model & discussion of style; Writing prompt
第3回: Session 3-Academic reading: text analysis and structure; Reading skills introduction; Reading prompt
第5回: Session 5-Reflective learning & study skills awareness through the use of electronic portfolios
第6回: Session 6-Seminar skills: Cultures of learning; Academic language task
第7回: Session 7-Reading skills session; Academic reading circles: Peer teaching
第8回: Session 8-Seminar skills: Cultures of learning; E-portfolio: Study skills exercise
第9回: Session 9-Reading skills session; Academic reading circles: Peer teaching
第10回: Session 10-Critical thinking task; E-portfolio: Study skills exercise
第11回: Session 11-Critical thinking task; Individual research project (Q & A: Analysis of Situation-Problem-Solution-Evaluation (SPRE) model
第12回: Session 12-SPRE writing task#1; E-portfolio: Study skills exercise; Academic language task
第16回: Session 16-SPRE writing task#2; E-portfolio: Study skills exercise
第20回: Session 20-SPRE writing task#3; E-portfolio: study skills exercise
第25回: Session 25-Final research presentation: Evaluation (including all of the SPRE model)
第27回: Session 27-Final research presentation: Evaluation (including all of the SPRE model)
